channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 'Bomb cyclone' forecasted to bring heavy snow, blizzard conditions and dangerous travel
item.description: A 'bomb cyclone' is intensifying severe winter weather for millions of people across the U.S. The system is expected to knock out power and disrupt holiday travel.
item.content:encoded:
A 'bomb cyclone' is intensifying severe winter weather for millions of people across the U.S. The system is expected to knock out power and disrupt holiday travel.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Kristin Wright

item.title: Jeffrey R. Holland, next in line to lead Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, dies at 85
item.description: Jeffrey R. Holland led the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles, a key governing body. He was next in line to become the church's president.
item.content:encoded:
Jeffrey R. Holland led the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles, a key governing body. He was next in line to become the church's president.

(Image credit: Rick Bowmer)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Winter storm brings heavy snow and ice to busy holiday travel weekend
item.description: A powerful winter storm is impacting parts of the U.S. with major snowfall, ice, and below zero wind chills. The conditions are disrupting holiday travel and could last through next week.
item.content:encoded:
A powerful winter storm is impacting parts of the U.S. with major snowfall, ice, and below zero wind chills. The conditions are disrupting holiday travel and could last through next week.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Kristin Wright

item.title: Disability rights advocate Bob Kafka dead at 79
item.description: Bob Kafka was an organizer with ADAPT (American Disabled for Attendant Programs Today), a group which advocates for policy change to support people with disabilities.
item.content:encoded:
Bob Kafka was an organizer with ADAPT (American Disabled for Attendant Programs Today), a group which advocates for policy change to support people with disabilities.

(Image credit: Ilana Panich-Linsman)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Is being in Congress still a good gig?
item.description: Inside Congress, lawmakers describe an institution under strain from polarization and constant pressure.
item.content:encoded: Inside Congress, lawmakers describe an institution under strain from polarization and constant pressure.
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Judge to hold hearing on whether Kilmar Abrego Garcia is being vindictively prosecuted
item.description: A federal judge this week canceled the trial of Kilmar Abrego Garcia, and scheduled a hearing on whether the prosecution is being vindictive in pursuing a human smuggling case against him.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge this week canceled the trial of Kilmar Abrego Garcia, and scheduled a hearing on whether the prosecution is being vindictive in pursuing a human smuggling case against him.

(Image credit: Stephanie Scarbrough)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: ICE is deporting some immigrants so quickly, their attorneys are left scrambling
item.description: Immigrants who are detained by ICE often get deported out of state so quickly that their attorneys don't have time to file petitions to keep them in the state where they were arrested.
item.content:encoded: Immigrants who are detained by ICE often get deported out of state so quickly that their attorneys don't have time to file petitions to keep them in the state where they were arrested.
item.dc:creator: Beenish Ahmed

item.title: Ranchers test virtual fence technology's ability to keep cows safe from grizzly bears
item.description: Technology enabling virtual fences for pets is now being adapted for livestock. Ranchers near Yellowstone National Park are testing its ability to keep cows safe from grizzly bear attacks.
item.content:encoded: Technology enabling virtual fences for pets is now being adapted for livestock. Ranchers near Yellowstone National Park are testing its ability to keep cows safe from grizzly bear attacks.
item.dc:creator: Hanna Merzbach

item.title: Operation Match: How the first computerized dating service came to be
item.description: Back in the 1960s, a couple of Harvard students had an idea. From Radio Diaries, this is a look back at the creation of the very first computerized dating service.
item.content:encoded: Back in the 1960s, a couple of Harvard students had an idea. From Radio Diaries, this is a look back at the creation of the very first computerized dating service.
item.dc:creator: Radio Diaries

item.title: Criminal justice experts explain why crime rates fell in 2025
item.description: Crime rates in the U.S. fell in 2025. Murders in particular fell dramatically. That is a major takeaway among criminal justice experts as we approach the year's end.
item.content:encoded: Crime rates in the U.S. fell in 2025. Murders in particular fell dramatically. That is a major takeaway among criminal justice experts as we approach the year's end.
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson
